sentences: Samuel Robert Rivers (born September 2, 1977) is the bassist and backing vocalist of the band Limp Bizkit, and one of its founding members.
In 1994, the three formed Limp Bizkit.
Later on guitarist Wes Borland came into the fold, as well as DJ Lethal, in 1996.
In 2015, Rivers reportedly left Limp Bizkit following a diagnosis of degenerative disc disease.
However, Rivers revealed in 2020 his departure from Limp Bizkit was due to liver disease caused by excessive drinking.
He was voted Best Bass Player at the 2000 Gibson Awards.
In early 2009, Rivers reunited with Limp Bizkit for tours and their sixth studio album, Gold Cobra released in 2011.
In early 2009, Rivers reunited with Limp Bizkit for tours and their sixth studio album, Gold Cobra released in 2011.
They released their self titled debut album on March 1, 2019.
Since 2019, Sam Rivers is using 5-string Fender Jazz Basses live with Limp Bizkit.
Rivers has also been seen using Wal Basses since 2005, mainly in the studio and uses Ampeg and Warwick amps.
In the early 2000s, Rivers married Kinter Atkins.

Rivers' talents on guitar would later come into play in Limp Bizkit's Results May Vary album, the only album not featuring longtime guitarist Wes Borland, with Rivers playing both guitar and bass on select songs such as "Creamer" and "Lonely World".
When their first album Three Dollar Bill, Yall was released, he was 19 years old.
Most recently, Rivers has been producing for the Orlando-based band Indorphine.

Rivers is now pursuing another project with Burn Season vocalist Damien Starkey  in a band called Sleepkillers, along with Adam Latiff and Saliva vocalist Bobby Amaru, who was also a founding member and drummer for Burn Season.
Currently Rivers is in a relationship with porn actress Kayla Paige.
